bug.author: Greg-Tarr
bug.summary: Wassa - UnicodeDecodeError: 'charmap' codec can't decode byte 0x81 in position 2280: character maps to <undefined>
bug.description:
Describe the bug It is a UnicodeDecodeError that occurs when using the flair.datasets.WASSA datasets. Can be seen here:
Î» python wassa-sad.py 2020-07-17 23:49:59,174 http://saifmohammad.com/WebDocs/EmoInt%20Train%20Data/sadness-ratings-0to1.train.txt not found in cache, downloading to C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\tmpqf9ay00c 92977B [00:00, 211589.48B/s] 2020-07-17 23:49:59,950 copying C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\tmpqf9ay00c to cache at C:\Users\me.flair\datasets\wassa_sadness\sadness-ratings-0to1.train.txt 2020-07-17 23:49:59,960 removing temp file C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\tmpqf9ay00c Traceback (most recent call last): File "wassa-sadness2-pooled.py", line 15, in corpus = WASSA_SADNESS() File "D:\Programs\Python\Python37\lib\site-packages\flair\datasets\document_classification.py", line 1607, in init _download_wassa_if_not_there("sadness", data_folder, dataset_name) File "D:\Programs\Python\Python37\lib\site-packages\flair\datasets\document_classification.py", line 1466, in _download_wassa_if_not_there next(f) File "D:\Programs\Python\Python37\lib\encodings\cp1252.py", line 23, in decode return codecs.charmap_decode(input,self.errors,decoding_table)[0] UnicodeDecodeError: 'charmap' codec can't decode byte 0x81 in position 2280: character maps to
To Reproduce from flair.datasets import WASSA_SADNESS corpus = WASSA_SADNESS() Expected behavior The above error will occur due to the encoding left unspecified on lines 1464, 1465 in flair.datasets.document_classification.py Environment (please complete the following information):
OS [e.g. iOS, Linux]: Windows 10 - Python 3.7.4 Version [e.g. flair-0.3.2]: 0.5.1 - but appears in non-master branches
Additional context I changed the lines 1464, 1465 in flair.datasets.document_classification.py to include the encoding when opening files and it has solved the problem: <denchmark-code>1464: with open(path, "r", encoding="UTF-8") as f: 1465: with open(data_file, "w", encoding="UTF-8") as out: </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Had the same error. After the encoding was specified it worked.
